hanzi-su-wiki:
吁

Значения

Вздыхать, ах, ох

Мнемоника

Набрать в 于 себя воздух через рот 口, чтобы сделать вздох.

Произношение и тон

xū
📢 Гости слушали её сюиту и вздыхали.

♫ Первый вздох новорожденного (1-й тон).

Варианты

籲

purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 籲)
Pictophonetic: 于 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
长吁短叹 [ cháng xū duǎn tàn ]: long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
吁吁 [ xū xū ]: to pant; to gasp for breath
喘吁吁 [ chuǎn xū xū ]: to puff and blow
气吁吁 [ qì xū xū ]: to pant; to gasp for breath
气喘吁吁 [ qì chuǎn xū xū ]: to pant; to gasp for breath
呼吁 [ hū yù ]: to call on (sb to do sth); to appeal (to); an appeal
吁请 [ yù qǐng ]: to implore; to entreat
黑奴吁天录 [ hēi nú yù tiān lù ]: Uncle Tom's Cabin, translated and adapted by Lin Shu 林纾
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
    • 于 [ yú ] at, in, on; to, from; alas!
heisig_chinese_memo: In the factory I use my mouth to plead with my boss to get a promotion from working on the clothing conveyor (belt) everyday.
Ru_trainchinese:
yū: (междом) тпру (используется как команда лошади остановиться или замедлиться)
xū: (глаг) вздыхать
xū: (междом) (книжн.) ох, ах, что, как (выражает удивление или недоумение)
yù: (графема) обращаться с призывом, просить поддержки
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You plead to the study group to let you in because you have a Chinese history test and there is one page about bamboo that you don't understand.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze and seal inscriptions start with " mouth " and " Yu ". The original meaning is to call out and shout out of panic. It is often used as an interjection. "Said the text": "Calls, scared also from the mouth, loss of sound.." Investigation " called on " the original word should be " on ", because " in " word and the " flat ", " Come ", " Down ", " Like the words " number ", they are all related to people's breath. However, due to " on " as a function words are borrowed " to " later in order to exclude ambiguities, is there to fill " mouth " to " to " from the side of the " Calls " to describe what refers to the mouth panic when called on gas This means, see " Yu ".

Bronze inscriptions are used as names, and they are seen in Wu Wangguangjian in the late Spring and Autumn Period.

Seal characters are used as surnames, such as "Ancient Seal Collection" 4019: "Xian Yu", pronounced "Xian Yu", used as a compound surname.

Ancient books are used as the original meaning, such as "Selected Works. Zhang Heng "Tokyo Fu": "Call! The virtues of the Han emperors, Hou Qiyi. It means that Deze, who admired the emperor of the Han Dynasty, is very beautiful. Another example is that in Li Bai's "Shu Dao Nan", there is "Wai Yu Xi, the danger is high! The difficulty of Shu Dao is difficult to climb to the sky."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze and seal scripts start with " kou " and " Yu ". The original meaning is to call out because of panic.
humanum_full_description:
金文與篆文從「口」，「于」聲，本義為因驚慌而呼告、呼喊，多用作嘆詞。《說文》：「吁，驚也。从口，亏聲。」查「吁」的原字應是「于」，因「于」字和「平」、「兮」、「乎」、「号」等字一樣，本都和人的呼吸氣息有關。但由於「于」被借作虛字的「于」，後來為了排除歧義，乃有以加注「口」於「于」之側而成的「吁」，以說明是指驚惶時以口吁氣這意思，參見「于」。

　　金文用作人名，見於春秋晚期的吳王光鑑。

　　印璽文字用作姓氏，如《古璽彙編》4019：「鮮吁」，讀為「鮮于」，用作複姓。

　　古書用作本義，如《文選．張衡〈東京賦〉》：「吁！漢帝之德，侯其禕而」。意謂讚歎汉代帝王的德泽非常美好；又如李白〈蜀道難〉中有「噫吁戲，危乎高哉！蜀道之難，難於上青天」。
humanum_short_description: 金文與篆文從「口」，「于」聲，本義為因驚慌而呼告。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
吁 (Trad.: 籲)
Total strokes: 6; Radical: 口
Pictophonetic: 于 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
    • 于 [ yú ] at, in, on; to, from; alas!
Step by Step Stroke Sequence: Download Customize Pin it
  • Pinyin: xū

    English Definition: sh; hush
    Example Words:
    长吁短叹 [ cháng xū duǎn tàn ]: long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
    吁吁 [ xū xū ]: to pant; to gasp for breath
    喘吁吁 [ chuǎn xū xū ]: to puff and blow
    气吁吁 [ qì xū xū ]: to pant; to gasp for breath
    气喘吁吁 [ qì chuǎn xū xū ]: to pant; to gasp for breath
    More: 吁* | *吁 | *吁*
  • Pinyin: yù

    English Definition: to implore
    Example Words:
    呼吁 [ hū yù ]: to call on (sb to do sth); to appeal (to); an appeal
    吁请 [ yù qǐng ]: to implore; to entreat
    黑奴吁天录 [ hēi nú yù tiān lù ]: Uncle Tom's Cabin, translated and adapted by Lin Shu 林纾
    More: 吁* | *吁 | *吁*

(Trad.: 籲)
Pictophonetic: 于 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 6
Freq: 2138
Chinese: In the factory I use my mouth to plead with my boss to get a promotion from working on the clothing conveyor (belt) everyday.
Meaning: plead
Hanzi: 籲
Story: You plead to the study group to let you in because you have a Chinese history test and there is one page about bamboo that you don't understand.
Kind: simplified

金文與篆文從「 口 」，「 于 」聲，本義為因驚慌而呼告、呼喊，多用作嘆詞。《說文》：「吁，驚也。从口，亏聲。」查「 吁 」的原字應是「 于 」，因「 于 」字和「 平 」、「 兮 」、「 乎 」、「 号 」等字一樣，本都和人的呼吸氣息有關。但由於「 于 」被借作虛字的「 于 」，後來為了排除歧義，乃有以加注「 口 」於「 于 」之側而成的「 吁 」，以說明是指驚惶時以口吁氣這意思，參見「 于 」。 金文用作人名，見於春秋晚期的吳王光鑑。 印璽文字用作姓氏，如《古璽彙編》4019：「鮮吁」，讀為「鮮于」，用作複姓。 古書用作本義，如《文選．張衡〈東京賦〉》：「吁！漢帝之德，侯其禕而」。意謂讚歎汉代帝王的德泽非常美好；又如李白〈蜀道難〉中有「噫吁戲，危乎高哉！蜀道之難，難於上青天」。
Bronze and seal inscriptions start with " mouth" and " Yu". The original meaning is to call out and shout out of panic. It is often used as an interjection. "Said the text": "Calls, scared also from the mouth, loss of sound.." Investigation " called on" the original word should be " on", because " in" word and the " flat", " Come", " Down", " Like the words " number", they are all related to people's breath. However, due to " on" as a function words are borrowed " to" later in order to exclude ambiguities, is there to fill " mouth" to " to" from the side of the " Calls" to describe what refers to the mouth panic when called on gas This means, see " Yu". Bronze inscriptions are used as names, and they are seen in Wu Wangguangjian in the late Spring and Autumn Period. Seal characters are used as surnames, such as "Ancient Seal Collection" 4019: "Xian Yu", pronounced "Xian Yu", used as a compound surname. Ancient books are used as the original meaning, such as "Selected Works. Zhang Heng "Tokyo Fu": "Call! The virtues of the Han emperors, Hou Qiyi. It means that Deze, who admired the emperor of the Han Dynasty, is very beautiful. Another example is that in Li Bai's "Shu Dao Nan", there is "Wai Yu Xi, the danger is high! The difficulty of Shu Dao is difficult to climb to the sky."

吁字的基本解释

吁
xū
叹息：长吁短叹。
叹词，表示惊疑：吁，是何言欤？

吁
（籲）
yù
为某种要求而呼喊：呼吁。吁天（呼天诉苦）。

吁字的康熙字典解释

吁字的起名意思

表示惊怪、不然、感慨等。

Call out
Basic explanation of words
Call out
xū
Sigh: Long sigh.
Interjection, expressing surprise: Yu, what is it?
Call out
(Call)
yù
Cry for a certain request: appeal. Yu Tian (Hu Tian complains).
Call out
Chinese dictionary definition of words
Call out
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
Call out
Source glyph
Call out
Name meaning
Express surprise, otherwise, emotion, etc.
xū, yū, yù
I xū
1) о!, ах!, увы!
吁, 君何见之晚也! ах, почему мой господин увидел это столь поздно!
吁, 是何言欤! о, как можно сказать такое!; ах, что вы говорите?!
吁! 来有邦有土 о, придите, правители государств и земель!
2) вздыхать
长吁短叹 беспрерывно вздыхать, со вздохами и стонами
3) * печалиться
云何吁矣! о, как мне горько!
3) Сюй (фамилия)
II yù кричать, выкрикивать (с целью исполнения какого-либо требования); взывать, созывать; просить
吁他守信 просить его сдержать своё обещание
III yū ну! (возглас, выражающий понукание, требование ускорить движение скота)

吁

吁 Набрать в 于 себя воздух
через рот 口, чтобы сделать
вздох.
xū Вздыхать, ах, ох
Гости слушали её сюиту
и вздыхали.
Первый вздох новорожденного (1-й тон).
